title: Damage From Hurricane Ike on Houston Area, Texas, 9.16.08

features.description: In Hitchcock nearly all residents were either major or destroyed. State Highway 6 is under water, making Hitchcock inaccessible.
La Marque had 60- 70% of the residences in standing water. 40 – 50% were either major or minor with some destroyed.
Texas City had 5% majors and 35% minors. No inaccessibility or standing water was viewed.
On the west shore of Trinity Bay, there were approximately 200 homes with 50% major and 50% minors. These homes were viewed traveling from Texas City to Wallsville and I-10 (along the shoreline).
Traveling south to Sabine Pass continued flooding was viewed in all Sabine/Inter-coastal areas. Sabine Pass is flooded and inaccessible. All homes there are either major or destroyed.
In Wallisville, approximately 20-30 homes were destroyed. Other damage was viewed in the Wallisville I-10 area

In the flyover in Orange, major flooding occurred in nearly all the city.  90% of homes and businesses had approximately 2-5 feet of water. Highway 87 is impassible. Sabine River and/or Inter-coastal canal caused massive flooding from Orange south.

name: Damage From Hurricane Ike on Houston Area, Texas, 9.16.08
description: Preliminary damage from Hurricane Ike on the Texas shoreline and Houston area.  The data was acquired by a FEMA flyover and NWS and focuses on number of houses effected.
